entries.title: Middle East Crisis: Biden Suggests Netanyahu Is Prolonging War to Stay in Power
entries.description: Asked if the Israeli prime minister was prolonging the war in Gaza to hold on to office, the president said that he believes “there is every reason for people to draw that conclusion,” echoing something many of his aides have been saying privately.

entries.title: Live Updates: Modi Claims 3rd Term in India, but His Party Suffers Losses
entries.description: Early election results indicated that the coalition of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India’s most powerful leader in generations, would win a narrower majority in Parliament.

entries.title: D-Day’s 80th Anniversary Might Be the Last for Many WWII Veterans
entries.description: It is 80 years since the Allied invasion of Normandy, and the average age of veterans hovers at 100. Once they are gone, how will their sacrifices be remembered?

entries.title: Rwanda’s 2024 Election: What to Know
entries.description: President Paul Kagame led Rwanda out of the genocide, but has since dominated the country like a colossus. He is running for a fourth term after winning three elections.

entries.title: Meet the Man Everyone Trusts on U.K. Election Nights: John Curtice
entries.description: Prof. John Curtice, a polling guru with a formidable intellect and an infectious smile, has contributed to Britain’s TV election coverage since 1979.

entries.title: Before a Debate, the U.K. Election Campaign Just Got Messier
entries.description: The surprise candidacy of Nigel Farage, a Trump ally and architect of Brexit, unsettled a stagnant campaign before a first TV debate Tuesday night.

entries.title: As Mexico Elects Claudia Sheinbaum, the Departing Leader Begins His Farewell
entries.description: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, who has been a defining figure in Mexican politics, has said he will retire to a family ranch after his term ends. Some expect his influence will continue.

entries.title: Mexico Joins List of Latin American Nations That Have Elected Female Presidents
entries.description: In contrast to the United States, the region has had more than a dozen female leaders, many in democracies that were once under the sway of authoritarian governments.

entries.title: What to Know About Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico’s Newly Elected President
entries.description: Here are five key insights into Mexico’s new president as people wonder whether she will diverge from Andrés Manuel López Obrador’s policies or focus on cementing his legacy.

entries.title: Jacob Zuma Gets His Revenge on South African Party That Shunned Him
entries.description: A new party led by Mr. Zuma, a former president forced out over corruption allegations, helped ensure that the African National Congress fell short of an outright majority for the first time since the end of apartheid.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: In Myanmar, a New Threat for the Rohingya
entries.description: Allegations against the Arakan Army, a key force in the fight against the junta, threaten to revive old horrors of sectarian atrocities.

entries.title: In Former Soviet States, a Tug of War Between East and West
entries.description: Geopolitical rivalry, intensified by fighting in Ukraine, is amplifying domestic struggles in countries like Georgia and Moldova whose people are split on which side to support.

entries.title: Intense Heat in Delhi Leaves Water in Short Supply
entries.description: A heat wave has left water in short supply across India’s capital region. The poorest are left to crowd around tankers to get whatever they can.

entries.title: Floods Break Dams and Submerge Highways in Southern Germany
entries.description: Several towns declared states of emergency and evacuated citizens as water submerged streets and highways and derailed a high-speed train.

entries.title: Some Gazans Call on Hamas to Accept Cease-Fire Proposal, But Remain Skeptical
entries.description: After months of bombardment, many in Gaza believe Hamas should make any compromise necessary to end the war.

entries.title: The Climate Challenges That India’s Next Government Will Face
entries.description: Farmers have repeatedly protested over grievances tied to global warming, a major political and economic test given the importance of India’s rural economy.

entries.title: India’s Stock Market Tumbles on Close-Run Election Result
entries.description: A bull run came to an abrupt end when Narendra Modi’s party fell short of expectations.

entries.title: Early Election Results Suggest Turnaround for Indian National Congress
entries.description: India’s beleaguered main opposition party was on track to surpass expectations and nearly double its share of parliamentary seats from 2019.

entries.title: Modi May Need Partners to Form India’s Next Government
entries.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on track to secure a third term, but a dip in his party’s electoral support will have political consequences.

entries.title: How Modi Capitalized on India’s Economic Rise
entries.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inherited a big and growing economy, kept it going and worked to put his imprint on every aspect of its success.

entries.title: Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: Mexico’s new president.

entries.title: Netanyahu’s Far-Right Partners Reject Cease-Fire Compromise
entries.description: Two coalition members threatened to topple Israel’s government if Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accepted a deal for a cease-fire and the release of hostages that stopped short of Hamas’s total destruction.

entries.title: Tuesday Briefing: Mexico Elects Its First Woman President
entries.description: Also, the U.S. is poised to change its asylum policy.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: Brazil’s Deadly Flooding Made Twice as Likely by Global Warming, Study Finds
entries.description: The country’s south received three months’ rain in two weeks. Global warming has made such deluges twice as likely as before, scientists said.

category.#text: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies

entries.title: Claudia Sheinbaum’s Morena Party Dominates Mexico’s Elections
entries.description: Expectations were high for the leftist Morena party, and it exceeded them, potentially giving President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum and her allies the power to enact systemic change.

entries.title: Israel Says 4 More Hostages Are Dead, Killed Months Ago in Gaza
entries.description: The disclosure by the military was likely to add pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government to move forward with a cease-fire deal.

entries.title: Brexit Champion Nigel Farage Will Run in U.K. Election
entries.description: Nigel Farage, an anti-immigration campaigner and Trump ally, reversed a pledge not to run. His Reform U.K. party hopes to take seats from Conservatives.

entries.title: Israel’s Seizure of Gaza Border Zone Strains Ties With Egypt
entries.description: Israel defied ominous Egyptian warnings and took control of the Philadelphi Corridor, but the reaction from Egypt, which wants to maintain its security cooperation with Israel, has been muted.

entries.title: What Are Eco-Friendly Ways to Control Backyard Bugs?
entries.description: Meet the “bucket of doom” and other methods to manage mosquitoes and ticks.

entries.title: Another Milestone in Mexico: Its First Jewish President
entries.description: Claudia Sheinbaum was born to Jewish parents, but she has played down her heritage on the campaign trail.

entries.title: Arrest Threatens Nepal’s Standing as Bastion of Free Speech
entries.description: A media executive was arrested after his company published critical reports about a powerful government minister.

entries.title: Monday Briefing
entries.description: South Africa rejects the party that ended apartheid.

entries.title: E.U. Elections Could Leave Hard Right Stumbling Over Its Own Decisions
entries.description: Elections starting this week for the European Parliament could leave far-right parties with more power than ever, but also expose the fissures among them.

entries.title: Monday Briefing: What’s Next for South Africa
entries.description: Also, India’s elections and internet in the Amazon.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: What’s Next for South Africa After Voters Rebuked Its Reigning Party?
entries.description: A look at the leaders who could shape the country’s future after the African National Congress’s poor showing in elections.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: Netanyahu May Face a Choice Between a Truce and His Government’s Survival
entries.description: The Israeli prime minister has been put on the spot by President Biden’s announcement outlining a proposal for a truce.

entries.title: Netanyahu may be forced to choose between a cease-fire and his government’s survival.
Claudia Sheinbaum Is Elected Mexico’s First Female President
entries.description: A climate scientist and former mayor, Ms. Sheinbaum became the first woman and Jewish person elected as president of the country.

entries.title: China Lands Spacecraft on Far Side of the Moon
entries.description: The landing brings the Chang’e-6 mission a step closer to being the first to return a sample from the part of the moon that’s never seen from Earth.

entries.title: 46 Children Were Taken From Ukraine. Many Are Up for Adoption in Russia.
entries.description: The New York Times traced how a web of officials and politicians aligned with President Vladimir V. Putin’s party carried out a campaign to permanently transfer Ukrainian children from Kherson.

category.#text: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

entries.title: Why Is North Korea Launching Balloons Carrying Trash?
entries.description: The unusual offensive, across the world’s most heavily fortified border, is a revival of a Cold War-era tactic. The South has threatened to respond by blasting K-pop.

entries.title: In Singapore, China Warns U.S. While Zelensky Seeks Support
entries.description: The annual Shangri-La Dialogue became a stage for competing demands on U.S. global power, including the war in Ukraine and tensions over Taiwan.

category.#text: United States Defense and Military Forces

entries.title: Why South African Voters Turned Against the A.N.C.
entries.description: Some South African voters welcomed the defeat of the African National Congress in last week’s elections, even as they remain wary of the country’s political future.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: Elon Musk’s Starlink Connects and Divides Brazil’s Marubo People
entries.description: Elon Musk’s Starlink has connected an isolated tribe to the outside world — and divided it from within.

entries.title: As Challenges Pile Up, a Spate of Summitry Spotlights Western Resolve
entries.description: Wars in Ukraine and Gaza, along with Donald J. Trump’s candidacy, are testing the Western alliance. But starting with the 80th anniversary of D-Day this week, leaders have a rare opportunity to showcase unity.

entries.title: Why a Pacific Island Is Blaming China for a Hack
entries.description: Palau’s claims that China orchestrated the attack remain unproven. But it’s clear that the breach presents a danger for another ally of Palau: the United States.

entries.title: U Tin Oo, Embattled Pro-Democracy Leader in Myanmar, Dies at 97
entries.description: A powerful figure in his country, he helped found its main opposition party. “I had to face up to the harm I did to people when I served in the army,” he said.

category.#text: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

entries.title: Robert Pickton, Notorious Canadian Serial Killer, Dies at 74
entries.description: Convicted in the murder of six women (though he boasted of killing many more), he died of unspecified injuries after being assaulted in prison.

entries.title: Protesters in Tel Aviv, Rome and Paris Urge Netanyahu to Accept Cease-Fire Proposal
entries.description: Thousands of demonstrators rallied in Israel on Saturday evening in support of the proposal. Protesters also gathered in Rome, Paris and Jakarta.

entries.title: After Biden’s Push for Truce, Netanyahu Calls Israel’s War Plans Unchanged
entries.description: The timing of the remarks seemed to rebuff the president’s hopes for a speedy end to the war. But some analysts said the prime minister was aiming at domestic supporters, not the White House.

entries.title: Yael Dayan, Israeli Writer, Politician and Daughter of War Hero, Dies at 85
entries.description: She was hailed for her books and admired for promoting women’s rights. But her support for a two-state solution to the Palestinian conflict angered many.

entries.title: India’s Exit Polls Show Modi Is Likely to Win a Third Term as Prime Minister
entries.description: While a newly united opposition seemed to gain some traction, exit polls showed the popular and entrenched prime minister was winning a third term.

entries.title: It’s June Again
entries.description: Summer returns, and with it all the feelings and fantasies and fears we associate with the season.

entries.title: Warnings of Election Meddling by China Never Reached the Prime Minister
entries.description: A watchdog agency found roadblocks to the flow of information both within the spy agency and the public service.

entries.title: South Africa Election: ANC Loses Majority for the First Time in 30 Years
entries.description: The African National Congress received less than 50 percent of the national vote for the first time since gaining power 30 years ago, setting the nation on an uncharted course.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: Notre-Dame Rises Again ... in Lego
entries.description: With rose windows, bell towers and a central spire, this model of the famed Paris cathedral is all the hype among adult fans of Lego, known as AFOLs.

entries.title: Why Mexico May Elect a Female President Before the United States
entries.description: Having a woman as president will be a milestone in a country where gender-based violence is so common. But how much will change remains unclear.

entries.title: She’s 98, and Walked Past Corpses to Escape Russian Attacks
entries.description: “If only everything would stop,” said Lidiia Lomikovska, who walked to safety after her town was attacked. But for civilians in the Donetsk region of Ukraine, it is not stopping.
